comments:
I copy all features & plugins of the CDT package to the eclipse directory. I 
launch Eclipse, tell it to install the new features, it restarts the workbench.

I create a new C++ project, named Hello World, located in c:\temp\testcdt. After 
creation, I add it a new file, name it test.cpp, and the following error is 
reported:

Unable to instantiate editor: org.eclipse.cdt.uieditor.CEditor
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/eclipse/jface/text/source/ICharacterPairMatcher

And indeed, if I look for the .class file in the jar files jfacetext.jar and 
jface.jar, it is missing, and I could not find any other jars containing classes 
in the package org.eclipse.jface.

The actual workbench I use was installed from a file named 
eclipse-SDK-M3-win32.zip and CDT was installed from a file named org.eclipse.
cdt-200305150256-win32_1.1.0.bin.dist.zip.

The .log file contents I suppose are not of any use, since the class file is 
really missing, however here it is (it's really hard to tell if this is actually 
related to the error described or not, since it is regenerated each time, and 
other errors occur too, but I suppose if the mistery with the missing class file 
is solved all errors will go away):

Using the released 2.1 version of Eclipse will not have this problem.
